page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT IN WYDDIAL
page.content: Jobs exist in the area on the farms, in the quarry, in the small industrial units at Silkmead and with the race horses there.However only two of the residents of the village are farm workers. Labour is mobile. Most of the working population travel out of the area, some to London, some working away all the week and returning at weekends. Some travel to the nearby towns. A few including a stock broker and an agricultural engineer work from home. There is no identifiable pattern of employment. Conversely the work actually performed in the area is undertaken by people who travel in to do it. Farm workers no longer live in tied cottages and a tractor driver has no responsibility for stock.
